greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of aperiodic n-gons.
comment: We define an n-gon to be aperiodic if all n rotations of its vertex set act on the edge set to give distinct n-gons. These are different from aperiodic graphs and acyclic graphs but are similar to aperiodic sequences (A000740) and aperiodic arrays (A323867).
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..200
Gus Wiseman, The a(5) = 10 aperiodic polygons.
Gus Wiseman, The a(6) = 42 aperiodic polygons.
example: The a(5) = 10 aperiodic polygon edge sets:
program: (PARI) a(n)={if(n<3, n==1, (if(n%2, 0, -n*(n/2-1)!*2^(n/2-2)) + sumdiv(n, d, moebius(n/d)*eulerphi(n/d)*(n/d)^d*d!/n))/2)} \\ _Andrew Howroyd_, Aug 19 2019
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Mar 04 2019
ext: Terms a(10) and beyond from _Andrew Howroyd_, Aug 19 2019
